intro: Lycopodium haematodes, commonly known as the red clubmoss, is a species of spore-bearing plant belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems that are often reddish in color, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, scale-like leaves and has a distinct reproductive structure called a strobilus, which contains the spore-producing organs. Lycopodium haematodes thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its spores are dispersed by wind, contributing to its reproductive success in suitable habitats.
